top_categories.workout_context: 224 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Traka 360's Rocky Mediterranean gravel, forest trails forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 224 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Traka 360's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
11,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Traka 360, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on rocky Mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
At Traka 360, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Traka 360's rocky Mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 224 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
224 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 11,000ft of climbing on rocky Mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack does to your power file on race day.
11,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 224 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 224 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Traka 360. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Traka 360 demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride rocky mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: rocky mediterranean gravel, forest trails, technical descents. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 224 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 224 miles of rocky mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack in Girona, Catalonia, Spain.
